requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: User registration and login with email, SSO, and multi-factor authentication

security_controls.section: Authentication, Session Management and Access Control
security_controls.requirement: Verify that authentication requirements for account creation and login use secure password handling, support for MFA, and integration with federated identity providers (SSO) where appropriate.
security_controls.relevance: Directly addresses secure registration and login mechanisms, including support for MFA and SSO integrations which are core to this requirement.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement secure password storage (bcrypt/Argon2), provide MFA options (TOTP, FIDO2), and integrate SSO via standard protocols (OIDC/SAML) with secure token handling.
security_controls.verification_method: Review authentication design, inspect MFA and SSO configuration, and perform authentication flow tests including replay/resilience tests.

security_controls.requirement: Organizational users shall be uniquely identified and authenticated. Supports multi-factor authentication for access to privileged and sensitive accounts.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies unique identification and MFA for users — applicable to user registration and login flows to ensure strong authentication.
security_controls.integration_tips: Enforce unique IDs, require MFA for privileged roles, and document authentication assurance levels. Use identity provider metadata and secure token storage.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect user account lifecycle, sample accounts for ANA/MFA enforcement, and verify logs show MFA usage for privileged accesses.

security_controls.requirement: The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restricted and controlled. Secure authentication techniques should be used, including multi-factor where necessary.
security_controls.relevance: Reinforces controlled provisioning and the use of secure authentication, which maps to registration, login, and role-based privilege assignment.
security_controls.integration_tips: Establish access provisioning procedures that require MFA for elevated roles and periodic review of accounts. Document SSO integrations in supplier agreements.
security_controls.verification_method: Review provisioning procedures, sampling of privileged accounts, and evidence of MFA enforcement and periodic access reviews.

security_controls.section: Authentication, Session Management and Access Control

security_controls.integration_tips: Enforce RBAC checks server-side for every operation, map roles to least-privilege permissions, and protect role assignments from unauthorized changes.
security_controls.verification_method: Code and configuration review of authorization checks, role-permission matrix review, and tests attempting privilege escalation.

security_controls.verification_method: Review account provisioning workflows, audit records for role changes, and test role deactivation scenarios.

security_controls.requirement: The organization employs the principle of least privilege, ensuring users have the minimum privileges necessary to perform tasks.

security_controls.integration_tips: Define role scopes narrowly and implement permission review cadence; apply separation of duties where roles overlap.
security_controls.verification_method: Permission audits, automated checks for unused privileges, and penetration testing for privilege escalation.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Automated assignment engine to match interpreters/translators by language, availability, certifications, and location

security_controls.requirement: Verify business logic and automated decision-making enforce authorization, prevent abuse, and ensure correctness and fairness in matching algorithms.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applicable to validating logic, preventing abuse, and ensuring fairness and correctness in automatic matching.
security_controls.integration_tips: Design algorithm governance (inputs validation, auditability), include explainability logs for matches, and enforce authorization checks for assignment actions.
security_controls.verification_method: Review algorithm logic, perform tests for edge cases, and audit decision logs for correctness and bias.

security_controls.requirement: The organization incorporates privacy and security requirements into the system architecture, including considerations for automated decision processes and data minimization.
security_controls.relevance: Requires the assignment engine to adhere to privacy/data minimization and security by design.
security_controls.integration_tips: Minimize personal data used for matching, document privacy impacts, and enforce access and logging for automated decisions.
security_controls.verification_method: Architecture review, data flow analysis, and privacy impact assessment for the matching engine.

security_controls.requirement: Security requirements for system components including custom algorithms should be specified and evaluated, ensuring integrity of automated assignment engines.
security_controls.relevance: Covers specifying security requirements for the automated engine component and ensuring its integrity.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define security requirements for algorithm components, conduct code review, and validate supplier libraries used by the engine.
security_controls.verification_method: Requirement traceability review, code audits, and component security assessments.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Task lifecycle management with configurable stages and progress tracking

security_controls.requirement: Verify workflows enforce authorization at each stage, maintain integrity of state transitions, and prevent unauthorized manipulation of task lifecycle.
security_controls.relevance: Directly ensures lifecycle stages are authorized and state transitions cannot be tampered with.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement state transition guards, validate user permissions at each stage change, and log transitions for auditability.
security_controls.verification_method: Workflow testing (attempting unauthorized transitions), code review of state machine, and log inspection.

security_controls.requirement: The organization reviews and analyzes information system audit records for indications of inappropriate or unusual activity affecting workflow and task states.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures monitoring of lifecycle changes to detect misuse or anomalies.
security_controls.integration_tips: Configure alerts for unusual state transitions, schedule regular audit reviews, and retain transition logs according to retention policy.
security_controls.verification_method: Review audit reports for lifecycle events and sample logs for anomaly detection.

security_controls.requirement: The organization develops, documents, and maintains baseline configurations and enforces control over changes which applies to configurable workflow stages.
security_controls.relevance: Applies to managing configurable stages and ensuring changes are controlled and auditable.
security_controls.integration_tips: Treat workflow configurations as code with version control, approvals, and change management processes.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect configuration change logs, code repository history, and approval records.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Attachments, comments, mentions (@mentions), and per-task activity logs

security_controls.requirement: Verify handling of user-provided content including attachments and comments, ensuring input validation, storage protection, and audit logging of user actions and mentions.
security_controls.relevance: Directly maps to protecting user-generated content and ensuring logs for actions and mentions.
security_controls.integration_tips: Validate and sanitize comments/mentions, restrict attachment types, protect stored content with access controls, and log all per-task interactions.
security_controls.verification_method: Content injection tests, file upload security tests, and auditing of comment and activity logs.

security_controls.requirement: The information system time-stamps audit records to provide accurate sequencing of events in activity logs.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures activity logs for tasks include reliable timestamps for event sequencing and forensics.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use synchronized time sources (NTP), record timezone-aware timestamps, and protect timestamp integrity in logs.
security_controls.verification_method: Check log timestamps for consistency and NTP configuration; validate event sequencing in samples.

security_controls.requirement: Administrator and operator activities shall be logged and the logs protected to ensure traceability, which extends to user activity logs for tasks.
security_controls.relevance: Supports requirement to log interactions and ensure traceability for auditing mentions and comments.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure activity logs are access-controlled and retained per policy; protect logs from tampering and provide audit capabilities.
security_controls.verification_method: Review logging policy, access controls on logs, and sample logs for completeness.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Real-time updates (notifications/WS) and an activity feed showing recent team actions

security_controls.requirement: Verify secure use of real-time communication channels (WebSockets, SSE) including encrypted transport (TLS), authentication, and protection against message tampering and replay attacks.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applicable to implementing secure real-time updates and activity feeds.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use TLS for all real-time channels, authenticate connections (token-based), implement message integrity checks, and prevent replay with nonces or sequence numbers.
security_controls.verification_method: Review WebSocket/TLS configs, test message tampering/replay scenarios, and verify authentication enforcement on connections.

security_controls.requirement: The information system protects the confidentiality and integrity of transmitted information.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures real-time feeds maintain confidentiality and integrity during transmission.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply end-to-end TLS, minimize data in real-time payloads, and use authenticated encryption where appropriate.
security_controls.verification_method: Network captures to verify TLS usage and payload encryption; review transport-level configs.

security_controls.requirement: The information system protects against or limits the effects of denial-of-service attacks, relevant to real-time notification channels.
security_controls.relevance: Important to maintain availability of real-time updates and activity feeds under load or attack.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement rate-limiting, connection limits, and DDoS protection for real-time endpoints.
security_controls.verification_method: Load and DDoS simulation tests and monitoring of real-time channel availability.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: File management: upload, preview, download, scanning, and file version history

security_controls.requirement: Verify secure handling of file uploads, including virus scanning, storage with access control, and prevention of direct access to uploaded files. Ensure versioning and integrity controls for document deliverables.
security_controls.relevance: Direct match for secure file lifecycle management including scanning and versioning.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use quarantines for suspicious uploads, signed short-lived URLs for previews/downloads, and maintain immutable version metadata with checksums.
security_controls.verification_method: Review file handling pipeline, test upload of known-malicious test files, and verify version history integrity.

security_controls.requirement: The organization provides protection to detect and eradicate malicious code, which applies to handling uploaded documents via scanning.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates malware scanning for uploaded files to prevent malicious code propagation.
security_controls.integration_tips: Integrate enterprise-grade malware scanners and sandboxing for previewing files; maintain signature and heuristic updates.
security_controls.verification_method: Check malware scanning logs and sandboxing outcomes; periodic testing with EICAR/test samples.

security_controls.requirement: Controls shall be implemented to detect and protect against malware, including scanning of files.
security_controls.relevance: Supports organizational requirement for malware protections in file management.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define operational procedures for malware handling in file operations and ensure timely updates and monitoring.
security_controls.verification_method: Operational policy review, scanning tool configuration inspection, and test evidence.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Role- and workspace-based file and task access controls

security_controls.section: Authentication, Session Management and Access Control
security_controls.requirement: Verify role-based access control is enforced server-side and follows the principle of least privilege; ensure separation of duties and role mappings are resistant to tampering.
security_controls.relevance: Applies to ensuring files/tasks are accessible only according to role and workspace policies.
security_controls.integration_tips: Enforce RBAC with tenant-aware checks on file and task APIs, and prevent privilege escalation between workspaces.
security_controls.verification_method: Access control testing across roles, attempt unauthorized file access across workspaces, and code review.

security_controls.requirement: The information system enforces approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources, supporting role and attribute-based controls.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures enforcement mechanisms exist for role/workspace-based access at the system level.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement centralized authorization service that evaluates role, workspace, and attributes before granting access.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect authorization service logs, policy definitions, and run access matrix tests.

security_controls.requirement: Access control policy shall be established based on business and information security requirements, including role and workspace specific restrictions.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates a policy foundation for role/workspace access controls.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document workspace access policies and map them to technical controls; include exception and review processes.
security_controls.verification_method: Policy review and evidence of policy enforcement through access logs and audits.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Email, in-app, and optional SMS notifications (assignments, status updates, mentions, approvals, daily summaries)

security_controls.requirement: Verify that outbound email/SMS notifications use secure channels, proper authentication (SPF, DKIM, DMARC), and protect sensitive content. Ensure user preferences and opt-outs are respected.
security_controls.relevance: Directly relevant to securing notification channels and protecting content/privacy preferences.
security_controls.integration_tips: Configure SPF/DKIM/DMARC, minimize sensitive data in messages, provide opt-out controls, and secure SMS providers with strong contracts and minimal data.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect mail system configs, test header authentication, and review notification content for data leakage.

security_controls.requirement: The information system implements cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality and integrity of information during transmission, such as notification messages.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures notifications transmitted over networks are protected in transit.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use TLS for API calls and webhooks, avoid sending sensitive data in plain-text notifications, and use signed tokens for webhook authenticity.
security_controls.verification_method: Network capture review to confirm TLS usage and inspection of outbound message payloads.

security_controls.requirement: Information involved in electronic messaging shall be protected in accordance with the information transfer policies and procedures.
security_controls.relevance: Requires formal handling and protection of electronic notifications.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document messaging policies covering email/SMS/in-app channels and ensure provider contracts reflect security expectations.
security_controls.verification_method: Policy and contract review, plus sampling message handling procedures.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Dashboards and reporting: task statistics, productivity, exports (CSV/PDF)

security_controls.requirement: Verify that reporting and export functionality enforces access control, minimizes sensitive data exposure, and provides aggregation or redaction where needed for privacy.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applies to securing dashboards and export features to prevent unauthorized data disclosure.
security_controls.integration_tips: Enforce RBAC for reports, redact or aggregate sensitive fields, and watermark or track exports with user identifiers.
security_controls.verification_method: Review report generation code, test exports under different roles, and verify redaction/aggregation.

security_controls.requirement: The organization determines and documents security and privacy requirements for systems, including reporting functions and export capabilities.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures reporting/export security requirements are documented and implemented.
security_controls.integration_tips: Include export controls in system requirements and ensure compliance via QA and privacy reviews.
security_controls.verification_method: Traceability review from requirements to implementation and testing of export controls.

security_controls.requirement: Information shall be classified and handling procedures established; reports and exports should follow handling rules to prevent unauthorized disclosure.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates classification-driven handling for exported reporting data.
security_controls.integration_tips: Classify report outputs and apply handling rules (encryption, access controls) accordingly before allowing downloads.
security_controls.verification_method: Check classification labels on report datasets and verify enforcement of handling rules on exports.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Agency financial and performance reporting (spend, SLA metrics)

security_controls.requirement: Verify that sensitive financial and performance data is protected, access is restricted based on role and tenancy, and reporting includes integrity checks and aggregation to limit exposure.
security_controls.relevance: Directly relevant to protecting financial reports and SLA metrics from unauthorized access or manipulation.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply strong access controls, use integrity checks (hashes, signatures) on report data, and aggregate sensitive metrics where possible.
security_controls.verification_method: Access policy review for financial reports and verification of integrity controls on exported data.

security_controls.requirement: The organization determines and documents security and privacy requirements for systems, including financial reporting and metrics handling.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures that financial reporting requirements are specified and met by the system.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define compliance and integrity requirements for financial modules and enforce via secure development and testing.
security_controls.verification_method: Review requirements documentation and test financial reporting modules for access and integrity.

security_controls.section: Data protection and privacy of personal data
security_controls.requirement: Ensure compliance with legal and contractual requirements related to processing and reporting financial and personal data.
security_controls.relevance: Useful if financial reports contain personal data or are subject to contractual obligations; supports compliance needs.
security_controls.integration_tips: Map legal/regulatory requirements to reporting features and apply contractual controls with agencies.
security_controls.verification_method: Legal/compliance review and evidence of controls meeting contractual requirements.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Integrations: Outlook/Teams calendar synchronization for bookings

security_controls.requirement: Verify integration with third-party APIs uses secure OAuth flows, least privilege scopes, and token management with proper refresh and revocation handling.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applies to calendar sync integrations using OAuth (Microsoft Graph) to ensure secure access.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use OAuth authorization code flow with minimal scopes, store tokens securely, and implement token revocation and consent management.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect OAuth flows, token storage, and scope usage; test token revocation and refresh.

security_controls.requirement: The organization monitors and controls external system connections and uses contracts and security requirements for integrations.
security_controls.relevance: Requires oversight and contractual controls for external calendar integrations.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define integration security requirements in contracts, monitor API usage, and enforce secure API gateways.
security_controls.verification_method: Review contracts and API usage logs; confirm monitoring and alerting for integration anomalies.

security_controls.requirement: Formal transfer policies, procedures and controls shall be in place to protect transferred information via networks and between organizations, including real-time feeds.
security_controls.relevance: Supports procedures for secure information transfer between system and calendar providers.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document data flows to/from calendar services, enforce encryption in transit, and limit shared data to necessary fields.
security_controls.verification_method: Data flow diagrams and checks that transfers use TLS and minimal data exchange.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Integrations: transactional email service, DocuSign (e-signatures), optional CAT tool integrations

security_controls.requirement: Verify integration with third-party APIs uses secure OAuth flows, least privilege scopes, and token management with proper refresh and revocation handling.
security_controls.relevance: Applies across external integrations (email providers, DocuSign, CAT tools) to ensure secure API/authentication patterns.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use secure credential storage, least-privilege API credentials, and ensure revocation procedures are available for provider keys.
security_controls.verification_method: Review integration auth methods, secrets management, and test revocation scenarios.

security_controls.requirement: Information security requirements for mitigating risks associated with supplier access to the organization's assets should be agreed with suppliers.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates managing supplier/integration risks and contractual security requirements for services like DocuSign and email providers.
security_controls.integration_tips: Establish SLAs, security requirements, and audit rights in supplier contracts; limit data shared with suppliers.
security_controls.verification_method: Contract review for security clauses and evidence of supplier assessments.

security_controls.requirement: The organization monitors and controls external system connections and uses contracts and security requirements for integrations.
security_controls.relevance: Provides actionable controls for monitoring and controlling third-party integrations.
security_controls.integration_tips: Monitor API calls, log integration activity, and enforce gateway policies to sanitize inputs/outputs with external services.
security_controls.verification_method: API gateway logs, monitoring dashboards, and incident records involving integrations.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Accessibility, responsive UI, and multi-language user interface

security_controls.requirement: Verify secure design includes accessibility and localization considerations; ensure input validation and encoding are applied across localized interfaces to prevent injection.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures accessibility and localization do not introduce security issues like injection or broken validation.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure localized inputs are validated and encoded, review UI frameworks for accessibility features, and include accessibility in secure design reviews.
security_controls.verification_method: Localization input tests, accessibility compliance testing, and review of localized encoding handling.

security_controls.requirement: Developers should adhere to secure development practices that include validating localized inputs and maintaining responsiveness and accessibility without compromising security.
security_controls.relevance: Encourages secure development processes that incorporate accessibility and localization testing.
security_controls.integration_tips: Include localization and accessibility in secure development lifecycle testing and threat models.
security_controls.verification_method: Secure SDLC artifacts showing localization/security tests and results.

security_controls.section: Identification of applicable legislation and contractual requirements
security_controls.requirement: Consider legal and regulatory requirements for accessibility and language support where applicable.
security_controls.relevance: Highlights legal/compliance obligations for accessibility and language — useful for design choices.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document applicable accessibility regulations (e.g., WCAG) and ensure UI meets required levels, balancing security and usability.
security_controls.verification_method: Compliance checklist and evidence of adherence to accessibility standards.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Audit logging, immutable activity records, and configurable data retention

security_controls.requirement: Verify that applications produce sufficient, tamper-evident audit logs for security-relevant events, protect log integrity, and support configurable retention policies.
security_controls.relevance: Directly addresses immutable logs and configurable retention for audit needs.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use append-only storage (WORM or cloud object locking) for logs, protect log access and support configurable retention periods per policy.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect log storage settings, retention configurations, and tamper-evidence mechanisms.

security_controls.requirement: The organization defines auditable events and the information system generates audit records for those events, protecting them from unauthorized modification.
security_controls.relevance: Requires definition and generation of auditable events covering activity records.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define audit event catalog, ensure events include sufficient context and secure log transport to protected stores.
security_controls.verification_method: Event catalog review and spot-checks of generated audit records.

security_controls.requirement: Audit records shall be protected against unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.
security_controls.relevance: Specifically enforces protection of logs from tampering and deletion.
security_controls.integration_tips: Restrict access to logs, use cryptographic integrity checks, and replicate logs to an immutable store.
security_controls.verification_method: Access control review for logs, checksum verification, and comparison across replicas.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Security, encryption, malware scanning, data loss prevention, and incident response controls

security_controls.requirement: Verify sensitive data is protected using strong cryptography in transit and at rest, keys are managed securely, and data loss prevention measures are applied where necessary.
security_controls.relevance: Covers encryption and DLP requirements for protecting data in the system.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use TLS 1.2+/strong ciphers for transport, AES-256 for data at rest where required, and integrate DLP controls for sensitive document detection.
security_controls.verification_method: Cryptography configuration reviews, key management audits, and DLP rule testing.

security_controls.requirement: The organization provides protection to detect and eradicate malicious code, which includes malware scanning of files and systems.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates malware scanning for files and systems to prevent compromise via uploads or attachments.
security_controls.integration_tips: Deploy anti-malware on endpoints and scanning in file pipelines, maintain signature updates and sandbox analysis for unknown files.
security_controls.verification_method: Malware scan logs, update records, and sandbox analysis evidence.

security_controls.requirement: The organization tests incident response capabilities and maintains incident response plans to detect, respond, and recover from incidents.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applicable to incident response planning and testing for security events affecting the platform.
security_controls.integration_tips: Develop and exercise IR plans covering data breaches, malware events, and DLP incidents; integrate with monitoring and alerting.
security_controls.verification_method: IR plan documentation, tabletop exercise evidence, and post-incident reviews.

security_controls.requirement: Require a process to identify, assess and remedy technical vulnerabilities and to manage incidents, including DLP and malware controls.
security_controls.relevance: Provides organizational-level controls for vulnerability and incident handling tied to malware and DLP.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement vulnerability management program, patching cadence, and incident handling processes aligned to ISO requirements.
security_controls.verification_method: Vulnerability scan reports, patch records, and incident management metrics.

cross_functional_controls.description: Centralized, tamper-evident logging for security-relevant events (authentication, authorization changes, file access, workflow transitions), timestamps, and configurable retention.
applies_to: all requirements (authentication, RBAC, file management, workflows, notifications, integrations)
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Use append-only storage or cloud object locking for logs, central SIEM for aggregation/analysis, protect logs with RBAC and cryptographic integrity, and implement retention policies tied to compliance.

cross_functional_controls.description: Use strong cryptographic protections for data in transit (TLS) and at rest (AES-256 or equivalent), including keys managed by an HSM or KMS.
applies_to: authentication tokens, profile data, files, notifications, integrations, backups
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Enforce TLS across endpoints, encrypt sensitive fields in databases, use managed KMS/HSM for key lifecycle, and ensure encryption configuration is regularly audited.

cross_functional_controls.description: Centralized authorization enforcement (RBAC/ABAC) with tenant/workspace awareness and least-privilege principles.
applies_to: user accounts, files, tasks, dashboards, integrations, admin functions
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Implement a centralized policy engine for authorization checks, require server-side enforcement for all APIs, and maintain role/permission catalogs with periodic reviews.

cross_functional_controls.description: Contractual and technical controls for third-party integrations (OAuth scopes, token management, supplier security requirements).
applies_to: calendar sync, email providers, DocuSign, CAT tools
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Use least-privilege OAuth scopes, store credentials securely, include security clauses in contracts, and monitor third-party API usage and anomalies.

cross_functional_controls.description: File scanning, sandboxing, and data loss prevention controls for uploaded documents and email attachments.
applies_to: file upload/preview/download, document workflows, email integrations
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Integrate AV scanners and sandboxing into file ingestion, configure DLP rules for sensitive content, and quarantine or block suspicious files.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: User registration and login with email, SSO, and multi-factor authentication

security_controls.section: Authentication, Session Management and Access Control
security_controls.requirement: Verify that authentication requirements for account creation and login use secure password handling, support for MFA, and integration with federated identity providers (SSO) where appropriate.
security_controls.relevance: Directly addresses secure registration and login mechanisms, including support for MFA and SSO integrations which are core to this requirement.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement secure password storage (bcrypt/Argon2), provide MFA options (TOTP, FIDO2), and integrate SSO via standard protocols (OIDC/SAML) with secure token handling.
security_controls.verification_method: Review authentication design, inspect MFA and SSO configuration, and perform authentication flow tests including replay/resilience tests.

security_controls.requirement: Organizational users shall be uniquely identified and authenticated. Supports multi-factor authentication for access to privileged and sensitive accounts.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies unique identification and MFA for users — applicable to user registration and login flows to ensure strong authentication.
security_controls.integration_tips: Enforce unique IDs, require MFA for privileged roles, and document authentication assurance levels. Use identity provider metadata and secure token storage.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect user account lifecycle, sample accounts for ANA/MFA enforcement, and verify logs show MFA usage for privileged accesses.

security_controls.requirement: The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restricted and controlled. Secure authentication techniques should be used, including multi-factor where necessary.
security_controls.relevance: Reinforces controlled provisioning and the use of secure authentication, which maps to registration, login, and role-based privilege assignment.
security_controls.integration_tips: Establish access provisioning procedures that require MFA for elevated roles and periodic review of accounts. Document SSO integrations in supplier agreements.
security_controls.verification_method: Review provisioning procedures, sampling of privileged accounts, and evidence of MFA enforcement and periodic access reviews.

security_controls.requirement: The organization employs the principle of least privilege, ensuring users have the minimum privileges necessary to perform tasks.

security_controls.relevance: Ensures enforcement mechanisms exist for role/workspace-based access at the system level.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement centralized authorization service that evaluates role, workspace, and attributes before granting access.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect authorization service logs, policy definitions, and run access matrix tests.

security_controls.requirement: Access control policy shall be established based on business and information security requirements, including role and workspace specific restrictions.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates a policy foundation for role/workspace access controls.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document workspace access policies and map them to technical controls; include exception and review processes.
security_controls.verification_method: Policy review and evidence of policy enforcement through access logs and audits.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Email, in-app, and optional SMS notifications (assignments, status updates, mentions, approvals, daily summaries)

security_controls.requirement: Verify that outbound email/SMS notifications use secure channels, proper authentication (SPF, DKIM, DMARC), and protect sensitive content. Ensure user preferences and opt-outs are respected.
security_controls.relevance: Directly relevant to securing notification channels and protecting content/privacy preferences.
security_controls.integration_tips: Configure SPF/DKIM/DMARC, minimize sensitive data in messages, provide opt-out controls, and secure SMS providers with strong contracts and minimal data.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect mail system configs, test header authentication, and review notification content for data leakage.

security_controls.requirement: The information system implements cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality and integrity of information during transmission, such as notification messages.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures notifications transmitted over networks are protected in transit.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use TLS for API calls and webhooks, avoid sending sensitive data in plain-text notifications, and use signed tokens for webhook authenticity.
security_controls.verification_method: Network capture review to confirm TLS usage and inspection of outbound message payloads.

security_controls.requirement: Information involved in electronic messaging shall be protected in accordance with the information transfer policies and procedures.
security_controls.relevance: Requires formal handling and protection of electronic notifications.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document messaging policies covering email/SMS/in-app channels and ensure provider contracts reflect security expectations.
security_controls.verification_method: Policy and contract review, plus sampling message handling procedures.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Dashboards and reporting: task statistics, productivity, exports (CSV/PDF)

security_controls.requirement: Verify that reporting and export functionality enforces access control, minimizes sensitive data exposure, and provides aggregation or redaction where needed for privacy.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applies to securing dashboards and export features to prevent unauthorized data disclosure.
security_controls.integration_tips: Enforce RBAC for reports, redact or aggregate sensitive fields, and watermark or track exports with user identifiers.
security_controls.verification_method: Review report generation code, test exports under different roles, and verify redaction/aggregation.

security_controls.requirement: The organization determines and documents security and privacy requirements for systems, including reporting functions and export capabilities.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures reporting/export security requirements are documented and implemented.
security_controls.integration_tips: Include export controls in system requirements and ensure compliance via QA and privacy reviews.
security_controls.verification_method: Traceability review from requirements to implementation and testing of export controls.

security_controls.requirement: Information shall be classified and handling procedures established; reports and exports should follow handling rules to prevent unauthorized disclosure.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates classification-driven handling for exported reporting data.
security_controls.integration_tips: Classify report outputs and apply handling rules (encryption, access controls) accordingly before allowing downloads.
security_controls.verification_method: Check classification labels on report datasets and verify enforcement of handling rules on exports.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Agency financial and performance reporting (spend, SLA metrics)

security_controls.requirement: Verify that sensitive financial and performance data is protected, access is restricted based on role and tenancy, and reporting includes integrity checks and aggregation to limit exposure.
security_controls.relevance: Directly relevant to protecting financial reports and SLA metrics from unauthorized access or manipulation.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply strong access controls, use integrity checks (hashes, signatures) on report data, and aggregate sensitive metrics where possible.
security_controls.verification_method: Access policy review for financial reports and verification of integrity controls on exported data.

security_controls.requirement: The organization determines and documents security and privacy requirements for systems, including financial reporting and metrics handling.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures that financial reporting requirements are specified and met by the system.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define compliance and integrity requirements for financial modules and enforce via secure development and testing.
security_controls.verification_method: Review requirements documentation and test financial reporting modules for access and integrity.

security_controls.section: Data protection and privacy of personal data
security_controls.requirement: Ensure compliance with legal and contractual requirements related to processing and reporting financial and personal data.
security_controls.relevance: Useful if financial reports contain personal data or are subject to contractual obligations; supports compliance needs.
security_controls.integration_tips: Map legal/regulatory requirements to reporting features and apply contractual controls with agencies.
security_controls.verification_method: Legal/compliance review and evidence of controls meeting contractual requirements.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Integrations: Outlook/Teams calendar synchronization for bookings

security_controls.requirement: Verify integration with third-party APIs uses secure OAuth flows, least privilege scopes, and token management with proper refresh and revocation handling.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applies to calendar sync integrations using OAuth (Microsoft Graph) to ensure secure access.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use OAuth authorization code flow with minimal scopes, store tokens securely, and implement token revocation and consent management.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect OAuth flows, token storage, and scope usage; test token revocation and refresh.

security_controls.requirement: The organization monitors and controls external system connections and uses contracts and security requirements for integrations.
security_controls.relevance: Requires oversight and contractual controls for external calendar integrations.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define integration security requirements in contracts, monitor API usage, and enforce secure API gateways.
security_controls.verification_method: Review contracts and API usage logs; confirm monitoring and alerting for integration anomalies.

security_controls.requirement: Formal transfer policies, procedures and controls shall be in place to protect transferred information via networks and between organizations, including real-time feeds.
security_controls.relevance: Supports procedures for secure information transfer between system and calendar providers.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document data flows to/from calendar services, enforce encryption in transit, and limit shared data to necessary fields.
security_controls.verification_method: Data flow diagrams and checks that transfers use TLS and minimal data exchange.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Integrations: transactional email service, DocuSign (e-signatures), optional CAT tool integrations

security_controls.requirement: Verify integration with third-party APIs uses secure OAuth flows, least privilege scopes, and token management with proper refresh and revocation handling.
security_controls.relevance: Applies across external integrations (email providers, DocuSign, CAT tools) to ensure secure API/authentication patterns.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use secure credential storage, least-privilege API credentials, and ensure revocation procedures are available for provider keys.
security_controls.verification_method: Review integration auth methods, secrets management, and test revocation scenarios.

security_controls.requirement: Information security requirements for mitigating risks associated with supplier access to the organization's assets should be agreed with suppliers.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates managing supplier/integration risks and contractual security requirements for services like DocuSign and email providers.
security_controls.integration_tips: Establish SLAs, security requirements, and audit rights in supplier contracts; limit data shared with suppliers.
security_controls.verification_method: Contract review for security clauses and evidence of supplier assessments.

security_controls.requirement: The organization monitors and controls external system connections and uses contracts and security requirements for integrations.
security_controls.relevance: Provides actionable controls for monitoring and controlling third-party integrations.
security_controls.integration_tips: Monitor API calls, log integration activity, and enforce gateway policies to sanitize inputs/outputs with external services.
security_controls.verification_method: API gateway logs, monitoring dashboards, and incident records involving integrations.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Accessibility, responsive UI, and multi-language user interface

security_controls.requirement: Verify secure design includes accessibility and localization considerations; ensure input validation and encoding are applied across localized interfaces to prevent injection.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures accessibility and localization do not introduce security issues like injection or broken validation.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure localized inputs are validated and encoded, review UI frameworks for accessibility features, and include accessibility in secure design reviews.
security_controls.verification_method: Localization input tests, accessibility compliance testing, and review of localized encoding handling.

security_controls.requirement: Developers should adhere to secure development practices that include validating localized inputs and maintaining responsiveness and accessibility without compromising security.
security_controls.relevance: Encourages secure development processes that incorporate accessibility and localization testing.
security_controls.integration_tips: Include localization and accessibility in secure development lifecycle testing and threat models.
security_controls.verification_method: Secure SDLC artifacts showing localization/security tests and results.

security_controls.section: Identification of applicable legislation and contractual requirements
security_controls.requirement: Consider legal and regulatory requirements for accessibility and language support where applicable.
security_controls.relevance: Highlights legal/compliance obligations for accessibility and language — useful for design choices.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document applicable accessibility regulations (e.g., WCAG) and ensure UI meets required levels, balancing security and usability.
security_controls.verification_method: Compliance checklist and evidence of adherence to accessibility standards.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Audit logging, immutable activity records, and configurable data retention

security_controls.requirement: Verify that applications produce sufficient, tamper-evident audit logs for security-relevant events, protect log integrity, and support configurable retention policies.
security_controls.relevance: Directly addresses immutable logs and configurable retention for audit needs.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use append-only storage (WORM or cloud object locking) for logs, protect log access and support configurable retention periods per policy.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect log storage settings, retention configurations, and tamper-evidence mechanisms.

security_controls.requirement: The organization defines auditable events and the information system generates audit records for those events, protecting them from unauthorized modification.
security_controls.relevance: Requires definition and generation of auditable events covering activity records.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define audit event catalog, ensure events include sufficient context and secure log transport to protected stores.
security_controls.verification_method: Event catalog review and spot-checks of generated audit records.

security_controls.requirement: Audit records shall be protected against unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.
security_controls.relevance: Specifically enforces protection of logs from tampering and deletion.
security_controls.integration_tips: Restrict access to logs, use cryptographic integrity checks, and replicate logs to an immutable store.
security_controls.verification_method: Access control review for logs, checksum verification, and comparison across replicas.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Security, encryption, malware scanning, data loss prevention, and incident response controls

security_controls.requirement: Verify sensitive data is protected using strong cryptography in transit and at rest, keys are managed securely, and data loss prevention measures are applied where necessary.
security_controls.relevance: Covers encryption and DLP requirements for protecting data in the system.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use TLS 1.2+/strong ciphers for transport, AES-256 for data at rest where required, and integrate DLP controls for sensitive document detection.
security_controls.verification_method: Cryptography configuration reviews, key management audits, and DLP rule testing.

security_controls.requirement: The organization provides protection to detect and eradicate malicious code, which includes malware scanning of files and systems.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates malware scanning for files and systems to prevent compromise via uploads or attachments.
security_controls.integration_tips: Deploy anti-malware on endpoints and scanning in file pipelines, maintain signature updates and sandbox analysis for unknown files.
security_controls.verification_method: Malware scan logs, update records, and sandbox analysis evidence.

security_controls.requirement: The organization tests incident response capabilities and maintains incident response plans to detect, respond, and recover from incidents.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applicable to incident response planning and testing for security events affecting the platform.
security_controls.integration_tips: Develop and exercise IR plans covering data breaches, malware events, and DLP incidents; integrate with monitoring and alerting.
security_controls.verification_method: IR plan documentation, tabletop exercise evidence, and post-incident reviews.

security_controls.requirement: Require a process to identify, assess and remedy technical vulnerabilities and to manage incidents, including DLP and malware controls.
security_controls.relevance: Provides organizational-level controls for vulnerability and incident handling tied to malware and DLP.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement vulnerability management program, patching cadence, and incident handling processes aligned to ISO requirements.
security_controls.verification_method: Vulnerability scan reports, patch records, and incident management metrics.

cross_functional_controls.description: Centralized, tamper-evident logging for security-relevant events (authentication, authorization changes, file access, workflow transitions), timestamps, and configurable retention.
applies_to: all requirements (authentication, RBAC, file management, workflows, notifications, integrations)
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Use append-only storage or cloud object locking for logs, central SIEM for aggregation/analysis, protect logs with RBAC and cryptographic integrity, and implement retention policies tied to compliance.

cross_functional_controls.description: Use strong cryptographic protections for data in transit (TLS) and at rest (AES-256 or equivalent), including keys managed by an HSM or KMS.
applies_to: authentication tokens, profile data, files, notifications, integrations, backups
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Enforce TLS across endpoints, encrypt sensitive fields in databases, use managed KMS/HSM for key lifecycle, and ensure encryption configuration is regularly audited.

cross_functional_controls.description: Centralized authorization enforcement (RBAC/ABAC) with tenant/workspace awareness and least-privilege principles.
applies_to: user accounts, files, tasks, dashboards, integrations, admin functions
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Implement a centralized policy engine for authorization checks, require server-side enforcement for all APIs, and maintain role/permission catalogs with periodic reviews.

cross_functional_controls.description: Contractual and technical controls for third-party integrations (OAuth scopes, token management, supplier security requirements).
applies_to: calendar sync, email providers, DocuSign, CAT tools
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Use least-privilege OAuth scopes, store credentials securely, include security clauses in contracts, and monitor third-party API usage and anomalies.

cross_functional_controls.description: File scanning, sandboxing, and data loss prevention controls for uploaded documents and email attachments.
applies_to: file upload/preview/download, document workflows, email integrations
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Integrate AV scanners and sandboxing into file ingestion, configure DLP rules for sensitive content, and quarantine or block suspicious files.
